title: Search Algorithm Engine (Overview)
text: Search Algorithm Engine is a small handwritten text search engine. It builds an inverted index, scores with TF-IDF, and ranks with cosine similarity. It supports phrase queries and boolean operators.

title: Phrase Queries
text: Phrase queries match adjacent terms in order. For example, the phrase "fast api" matches documents containing fast api next to each other.

title: Boolean Operators
text: Boolean operators supported are AND, OR, and NOT. Precedence is NOT, then AND, then OR. Implicit AND is also supported: writing fast api means fast AND api.

title: Ranking
text: Ranking uses TF-IDF weighting and cosine similarity. IDF is smoothed as log((N + 1) / (df + 1)) + 1 to avoid division-by-zero.
